Key Match Events: Australia won the first T20 match against New Zealand with a nail-biting six-wicket victory
Tim David hit a four off the last ball to win the match for Australia
Rachin Ravindra scored 68 runs off 35 balls for New Zealand
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh admitted that he thought Australia were done and thanked Tim David for his calmness and confidence
Mitchell Santner said that New Zealand didn't bowl too bad but needed to take wickets to stop Australia
Miscellaneous Highlights: The three-match series is the last for both teams before the T20 World Cup in the United States and West Indies in June
Others: The game went to the wire after New Zealand seamer Adam Milne was smashed for 19 runs in the penultimate over
Australia needed 15 from the last six balls, but David held his nerve by smashing a six before sending the final ball of the night to the boundary past a diving Phillips
